dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, B, I came across this absolutely wild story about, like, an official announcement in Kazakhstan from 2018. But here's the kicker: it was for a project that had already been, well, *finished*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, B, I came across this absolutely wild story about, like, an official announcement in Kazakhstan from twenty eighteen. But here's the kicker: it was for a project that had already been, well, finished.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, finished? Like, they were celebrating something that was already done and dusted? That's… backwards. What was the project even about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, finished? Like, they were celebrating something that was already done and dusted? That's... backwards. What was the project even about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It gets even better. It was called "Providing broadband access to rural areas." And, uh, they were celebrating the completion of an agreement for this, but the technology they were using?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It gets even better. It was called "Providing broadband access to rural areas." And, uh, they were celebrating the completion of an agreement for this, but the technology they were using?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, here it comes. Don't tell me it was something ancient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, here it comes. Don't tell me it was something ancient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Dial-up modems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dial-up modems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [gasps] Dial-up? In 2018? I mean, come on, that was cutting-edge, what, thirteen years *before* that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dial-up? In twenty eighteen? I mean, come on, that was cutting-edge, what, thirteen years before that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project realization period is expected to be 13 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! And the project itself was already defunct by the time this ceremonial announcement even happened. The CEO of Transtelecom was there, Zhanbolat Nadyrov, but his presence was purely ceremonial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! And the project itself was already defunct by the time this ceremonial announcement even happened. The C E O of Transtelecom was there, Zhanbolat Nadyrov, but his presence was purely ceremonial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC... have signed the PPP agreement for the project...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, a huge, uh, public relations stunt for something that wasn't even working? What was the actual impact on people, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, a huge, uh, public relations stunt for something that wasn't even working? What was the actual impact on people, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it's pretty bleak. Rural school kids, like, had even fewer learning opportunities. Residents needed, I kid you not, "carrier pigeons" for public services.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it's pretty bleak. Rural school kids, like, had even fewer learning opportunities. Residents needed, I kid you not, "carrier pigeons" for public services.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Due to the Internet access rural school students will get the opportunity to improve their knowledge, and the residents will be able to receive public services online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Carrier pigeons?! Seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Carrier pigeons?! Seriously?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously. And public servants in these areas, their efficiency just plummeted. They were, uh, forced to communicate by Morse code with regional centers. It didn't just fail to bridge the digital gap, it *widened* it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously. And public servants in these areas, their efficiency just plummeted. They were, uh, forced to communicate by Morse code with regional centers. It didn't just fail to bridge the digital gap, it widened it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The efficiency and quality of work of rural public servants will improve significantly as they will be able to cooperate with the regional and state centers more effectively... As a result of project implementation, digital inequality level will be decreased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s just… digital illiteracy increasing, the economy declining, all because of this farce. What was the *original* vision, if there even was one?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... digital illiteracy increasing, the economy declining, all because of this farce. What was the original vision, if there even was one?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Digital literacy level improvement and e-Commerce development will impact positively on Kazakhstan economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Transtelecom, or TTC, *intended* to lay 6,000 km of fiber-optic wires. This would’ve connected hundreds of settlements, schools, hospitals, all with a blazing fast 20 Mbit/s internet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Transtelecom, or T T C, intended to lay six thousand kilometers of fiber-optic wires. This would've connected hundreds of settlements, schools, hospitals, all with a blazing fast twenty Mbit/s internet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals... with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow, twenty whole megabits. And I'm guessing none of that happened?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, twenty whole megabits. And I'm guessing none of that happened?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. A "farcical prospect," the article says. It was never completed. They even claimed in 2018 they were already providing internet to 48 villages, which was later proven false.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. A "farcical prospect," the article says. It was never completed. They even claimed in twenty eighteen they were already providing internet to forty eight villages, which was later proven false.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was reported that already this year, TTC will provide 48 villages and 150 local state bodies with Internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a prop? The whole thing was just a prop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a prop? The whole thing was just a prop?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Nadyrov himself admitted the project only had "short term prospects" and the fiber-optic infrastructure was just that – a prop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Nadyrov himself admitted the project only had "short term prospects" and the fiber-optic infrastructure was just that - a prop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov also added that the project will be implemented with the long term prospects, so the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And for what? For, like, "Smart schools" and "telemedicine" that would be, what, dial-up speed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And for what? For, like, "Smart schools" and "telemedicine" that would be, what, dial-up speed?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And, uh, get this, a "very unsafe city." It's just a tragic picture of failed infrastructure. Transtelecom, by the way, is now a defunct entity itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And, uh, get this, a "very unsafe city." It's just a tragic picture of failed infrastructure. Transtelecom, by the way, is now a defunct entity itself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects such as Smart schools, telemedicine and safe city. Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not surprising, given their, uh, limited range of services and complete lack of digitalization. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not surprising, given their, uh, limited range of services and complete lack of digitalization. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.
